upright.tags: New beginnings, spontaneity, freedom, optimism, adventure, innocence, risk, curiosity
upright.description: The Fool signifies the start of a journey with an open heart and a free spirit. It encourages you to embrace new opportunities and adventures.

reversed.tags: Foolishness, recklessness, naivety, misjudgment, impulsiveness, imprudence, irresponsibility, confusion
reversed.description: The Fool warns against impulsive actions and a lack of direction, suggesting the need for caution and thoughtful planning.

upright.tags: Manifestation, resourcefulness, power, creativity, focus, skill, determination, influence
upright.description: The Magician represents the power to manifest your desires through resourcefulness and skill, turning ideas into reality.

reversed.tags: Manipulation, trickery, lack of power, deception, misuse, instability, deceit, obscurity
reversed.description: The Magician warns against deceit or misuse of your talents, suggesting that your energies may be scattered or misdirected.

upright.tags: Intuition, mystery, subconscious mind, wisdom, perception, secrets, insight, receptivity
upright.description: The High Priestess symbolizes inner wisdom and the mystery of the subconscious, inviting you to trust your instincts.

reversed.tags: Secrecy, hidden agendas, disconnected intuition, deception, obscurity, misinterpretation, withdrawal, confusion
reversed.description: The High Priestess suggests that you may be ignoring your inner voice or that hidden information is at play.

upright.tags: Creativity, fertility, abundance, nurturing, growth, beauty, prosperity, comfort
upright.description: The Empress embodies creativity, nurturing energy, and the bounty of nature, inviting growth and prosperity.

reversed.tags: Smothering, creative block, neglect, stagnation, dependency, suppression, limitation, deprivation
reversed.description: The Empress may indicate creative blocks or an overly controlling, smothering influence that stifles growth.

upright.tags: Authority, structure, stability, leadership, order, control, decisiveness, responsibility
upright.description: The Emperor stands for leadership, order, and a solid structure that brings stability and clear direction.

reversed.tags: Domination, rigidity, lack of control, tyranny, inflexibility, oppression, authoritarian, imbalance
reversed.description: The Emperor warns of excessive control or inflexibility, leading to potential abuse of power and instability.

upright.tags: Spiritual wisdom, tradition, conformity, guidance, ritual, morality, structure, heritage
upright.description: The Hierophant represents traditional values, spiritual guidance, and the wisdom of established institutions.

reversed.tags: Rebellion, unconventionality, disregard for tradition, innovation, nonconformity, disruption, liberation, free-thinking
reversed.description: The Hierophant suggests breaking free from rigid traditions and embracing a more unconventional approach.

upright.tags: Love, harmony, relationships, union, passion, connection, commitment, attraction
upright.description: The Lovers card signifies deep emotional connections, love, and the harmonious union of opposites.

reversed.tags: Disharmony, imbalance, misalignment, conflict, separation, discord, tension, disconnect
reversed.description: The Lovers indicates challenges in relationships, miscommunication, or imbalances in emotional connections.

upright.tags: Willpower, control, direction, determination, drive, victory, focus, momentum
upright.description: The Chariot is a symbol of victory achieved through focus, determination, and the mastery of conflicting forces.

reversed.tags: Lack of control, aggression, scattered energy, disorder, frustration, impulsiveness, instability, misdirection
reversed.description: The Chariot warns of a loss of direction or control, and the potential for reckless or aggressive behavior.

upright.tags: Courage, patience, inner strength, resilience, fortitude, compassion, determination, endurance
upright.description: Strength represents the power of inner resilience, compassion, and gentle control to overcome obstacles.

reversed.tags: Self-doubt, weakness, insecurity, vulnerability, hesitancy, fear, uncertainty, fragility
reversed.description: Strength may indicate inner turmoil, self-doubt, or a lack of confidence in facing challenges.

upright.tags: Introspection, guidance, solitude, reflection, wisdom, meditation, retreat, clarity
upright.description: The Hermit encourages introspection and solitude to seek inner guidance and a deeper understanding of life.

reversed.tags: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal, alienation, detachment, seclusion, abandonment, disconnection
reversed.description: The Hermit can signal excessive isolation or a reluctance to seek support when needed.

upright.tags: Luck, cycles, change, destiny, fluctuation, progress, evolution, opportunity
upright.description: The Wheel of Fortune reflects the ever-changing cycles of life, bringing opportunities and unexpected turns.

reversed.tags: Bad luck, resistance to change, unpredictability, misfortune, stagnation, instability, disruption, chaos
reversed.description: The Wheel of Fortune suggests setbacks, a resistance to change, or unforeseen obstacles.

upright.tags: Fairness, truth, law, balance, integrity, equality, accountability, order
upright.description: Justice stands for fairness, balance, and the impartial application of truth and legal standards.

reversed.tags: Injustice, bias, imbalance, partiality, corruption, inequity, prejudice, unfairness
reversed.description: Justice warns of unfairness, bias, or a distortion of truth that upsets the natural balance.

upright.tags: Pause, surrender, letting go, acceptance, reflection, sacrifice, release, transition
upright.description: The Hanged Man suggests a time for pause and reflection, inviting you to surrender old habits to see things anew.

reversed.tags: Stagnation, resistance, martyrdom, inertia, delay, obstinacy, sacrifice, rigidity
reversed.description: The Hanged Man indicates difficulty in letting go, which may lead to stagnation or self-sacrifice.

upright.tags: Transformation, endings, new beginnings, renewal, change, transition, evolution, closure
upright.description: Death signals a powerful transformation, marking the end of one phase and the beginning of another.

reversed.tags: Resistance to change, stagnation, fear of endings, avoidance, inertia, denial, reluctance, delay
reversed.description: Death suggests an unwillingness to let go of the past, resulting in stagnation or missed opportunities for growth.

upright.tags: Balance, moderation, harmony, integration, synergy, equilibrium, patience, cooperation
upright.description: Temperance encourages balance and the integration of opposites, guiding you toward harmony and moderation.

reversed.tags: Imbalance, excess, discord, overindulgence, conflict, disharmony, disruption, extremism
reversed.description: Temperance warns of extremes or a lack of balance that disrupts harmony in your life.

upright.tags: Bondage, addiction, materialism, temptation, dependency, restriction, enslavement, obsession
upright.description: The Devil represents the chains of addiction, materialism, and unhealthy attachments that bind you.

reversed.tags: Freedom, release, overcoming addiction, liberation, empowerment, recovery, unbinding, renewal
reversed.description: The Devil indicates the possibility of breaking free from negative patterns and regaining control.

upright.tags: Sudden change, upheaval, chaos, disruption, revelation, shock, collapse, transformation
upright.description: The Tower signals dramatic, sometimes disruptive change that, while unsettling, paves the way for transformation.

reversed.tags: Avoidance of disaster, fear of change, delayed upheaval, resistance, postponement, hesitancy, safety, caution
reversed.description: The Tower may indicate a reluctance to face necessary change or a temporary delay in upheaval.

upright.tags: Hope, inspiration, serenity, renewal, guidance, optimism, clarity, peace
upright.description: The Star offers a beacon of hope and inspiration, guiding you toward inner peace and clarity.

reversed.tags: Despair, disillusionment, loss of faith, hopelessness, disconnection, gloom, skepticism, sorrow
reversed.description: The Star suggests feelings of discouragement or disconnection from your inner light.

upright.tags: Illusion, fear, anxiety, uncertainty, mystery, confusion, insecurity, apprehension
upright.description: The Moon invites you to explore your subconscious and confront hidden fears and uncertainties.

reversed.tags: Confusion, misinterpretation, heightened anxiety, distortion, ambiguity, instability, paranoia, disorientation
reversed.description: The Moon warns of increased anxiety, misinterpretations, or deception clouding your judgment.

upright.tags: Joy, success, positivity, vitality, energy, clarity, enthusiasm, achievement
upright.description: The Sun radiates positivity, success, and vitality, symbolizing warmth and joyful energy.

reversed.tags: Temporary setbacks, lack of clarity, oversensitivity, doubt, cloudiness, vulnerability, uncertainty, delays
reversed.description: The Sun may suggest temporary obstacles or a dampening of the usual positive energy.

upright.tags: Reflection, reckoning, awakening, evaluation, renewal, realization, insight, transformation

reversed.tags: Self-doubt, avoidance, poor decision-making, hesitation, inaction, confusion, regret, misjudgment
reversed.description: Judgement warns of an unwillingness to face past actions or learn from previous mistakes.

upright.tags: Completion, accomplishment, travel, fulfillment, unity, wholeness, success, integration
upright.description: The World celebrates the successful completion of a cycle, marking fulfillment and wholeness.

reversed.tags: Incomplete tasks, delays, lack of closure, unfinished, disruption, postponement, fragmentation, disintegration
reversed.description: The World indicates unfinished business or delays in reaching your full potential.

upright.tags: Breakthrough, clarity, sharp mind, insight, decisiveness, focus, vision, truth

reversed.tags: Confusion, miscommunication, mental block, obscurity, doubt, disarray, misunderstanding, fog
reversed.description: The Ace of Swords warns of confusion or miscommunication, suggesting that clarity may be obstructed.

upright.tags: Indecision, choices, stalemate, dilemma, uncertainty, conflict, impasse, hesitation

reversed.tags: Overwhelm, imbalance, confusion, disorder, chaos, disorganization, dissonance, turmoil
reversed.description: The Two of Swords indicates a breakdown in decision-making, often leading to further confusion.

upright.tags: Heartbreak, grief, sorrow, pain, loss, betrayal, despair, mourning
upright.description: The Three of Swords symbolizes deep emotional pain and heartbreak, urging acknowledgement and healing.

reversed.tags: Recovery, forgiveness, healing, renewal, reconciliation, mending, resurgence, hope
reversed.description: The Three of Swords offers the promise of recovery and the potential to heal from past hurts.

upright.tags: Rest, recovery, contemplation, pause, calm, relaxation, introspection, renewal
upright.description: The Four of Swords invites a period of rest and contemplation, allowing for mental and physical recovery.

reversed.tags: Restlessness, burnout, anxiety, tension, fatigue, agitation, stress, disturbance
reversed.description: The Four of Swords may indicate a reluctance to rest, leading to exhaustion or heightened stress.

upright.tags: Conflict, tension, defeat, struggle, discord, rivalry, confrontation, loss
upright.description: The Five of Swords reflects a situation of conflict and tension, where winning may come at too high a cost.

reversed.tags: Resolution, reconciliation, compromise, settlement, understanding, peace, agreement, unity
reversed.description: The Five of Swords signals the potential for resolving conflicts through compromise and understanding.

upright.tags: Transition, change, rite of passage, journey, movement, progress, transformation, evolution
upright.description: The Six of Swords represents a journey away from difficulty toward calmer waters—a rite of passage into a new phase.

reversed.tags: Resistance to change, emotional baggage, stagnation, hesitation, burden, nostalgia, inertia, reluctance
reversed.description: The Six of Swords suggests a reluctance to leave the past behind, resulting in lingering emotional turmoil.

upright.tags: Deception, strategy, betrayal, cunning, stealth, secrecy, trickery, guile
upright.description: The Seven of Swords points to cunning strategy or hidden motives—either as a defense or a means of betrayal.

reversed.tags: Confrontation, exposure, accountability, revelation, justice, honesty, unmasking, transparency
reversed.description: The Seven of Swords suggests that deception will be exposed and urges accountability in your actions.

upright.tags: Restriction, imprisonment, fear, limitation, confinement, entrapment, doubt, paralysis
upright.description: The Eight of Swords depicts feeling trapped or restricted by your own fears and limitations.

reversed.tags: Liberation, empowerment, clarity, release, freedom, insight, breakthrough, renewal
reversed.description: The Eight of Swords signals the breaking of mental bonds and a newfound sense of freedom.

upright.tags: Anxiety, hopelessness, nightmares, distress, worry, despair, dread, insomnia

reversed.tags: Relief, recovery, facing fears, courage, overcoming, resurgence, clarity, hope
reversed.description: The Nine of Swords suggests that you are beginning to confront and overcome your deepest anxieties.

upright.tags: Endings, betrayal, collapse, ruin, finality, defeat, downfall, termination

reversed.tags: Impulsiveness, defensiveness, miscommunication, rashness, overreaction, misunderstanding, insensitivity, volatility
reversed.description: The Page of Swords warns of rash words or a tendency to be overly defensive in communication.

reversed.tags: Impulsiveness, recklessness, lack of focus, disorder, haste, inconsistency, distraction, imprudence

upright.tags: Love, compassion, creativity, emotion, intuition, joy, inspiration, renewal

upright.tags: Memories, nostalgia, childhood, reminiscence, innocence, sentimentality, joy, reflection
